channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: The NFL Finally Cut the Cord, and It's a Mess
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Streaming exclusives are making the NFL harder to watch.
item.content:encoded: We're now several weeks into the 2025-26 NFL season, and it's been nothing short of electric. Watching from regular TV stations is still possible, but things are changing. The NFL recently cut the cord and gave YouTube the Sunday Ticket, and several upcoming games will air exclusively on streaming platforms. It's a mess.

item.title: Before Netflix's Frankenstein, Check Out These 10 Movie Monster Makeovers
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the monster movie makeovers that made these dark creatures hog more of the spotlight.
item.content:encoded: Monster movies are entertaining, but there are times when those old monstrosities look a little basic. While it’s essential to pay respect to such classics as Boris Karloff’s Frankenstein’s monster and Bela Lugosi’s Dracula, not all of their scary nature has stood the test of time. Some padded makeup and stuck-on appendages might’ve been enough to scare audiences of the 1930s, but times change, and you need a little more.

item.title: 8 Ways to Use the Python open() Function
item.dc:creator: Bobby Jack
item.content:encoded: Python’s open function should be your first port of call when you’re looking to read the contents of a file. Give it a filename and you’ll get back a versatile object, letting you read and write data, both in plain text and binary formats.

item.title: How I Control My Smart Home From My CarPlay Dashboard
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: What a time to be alive.
item.content:encoded: CarPlay lets you control your iPhone using your car’s dashboard or entertainment unit, but did you know you can also use it to control your smart home?

item.title: Think You Need a Wired Mouse and Keyboard for Gaming? Think Again
item.dc:creator: Ismar Hrnjicevic
item.content:encoded: For decades, wired mice and keyboards were considered the only option for serious PC gaming. Bluetooth was just too unreliable for competitive play. Today, however, wireless technology has advanced to the point where there’s little reason to stick with wired.

item.title: 9 Zombie Movies Where the Dead Are Fast and Wicked Smart—Ranked
item.dc:creator: Keeley Brooks
item.description: Is these types of zombies chase us, I'm definitely tripping you.
item.content:encoded: If lightning-fast, wicked-smart zombies ever chase us, I’m tripping you. I’m kidding. But seriously, traditionally, the zombie genre of movies and TV tends to be full of sluggish, easy-to-kill, dumb-dums, which makes for some gory, fun entertainment. But as the genre has evolved, some of the scariest zombie movies are now known for their rapid-paced, agile, infected beings, who’ve evolved into hybrid monsters of incredible speed and smarts.

item.title: This Is the Easiest Way to Set Up Your New Windows PC
item.dc:creator: Shan Abdul
item.description: Restore what you need, the right way!
item.content:encoded: Moving files and configuring settings and preferences when setting up a new Windows computer (or after a reset) can be frustrating. But with Windows Backup integrated into Windows’ Out-of-Box Experience (OOBE), the process has become much easier. Here’s how it works and how you can put it to use.

item.title: How to Close the Gap on PC Gaming Performance Without Paying for an Upgrade
item.dc:creator: Timothy Jacob Hudson
item.description: Games are getting more demanding all the time, but upgrading your computer is expensive. These tips can help you make up for a gap in performance.
item.content:encoded: Video games demand more performance from our PCs with every passing year, but we can't all afford to upgrade. But there are some shortcuts and workarounds we can use to help bridge the gap between PC performance and the demands of the next big game.

item.title: Arch Linux's AUR Wasted My Time Until I Did This
item.dc:creator: Dibakar Ghosh
item.description: The Chaotic AUR is one of the most powerful set-it-and-forget-it productivity hacks for Arch Linux users.
item.content:encoded: Ever waited an hour (or more) for an AUR package to compile on your Arch system? Do you find yourself avoiding certain apps simply because the compilation time is unbearable? Well, let me introduce you to Chaotic-AUR and how it completely changed my Arch experience.

item.title: How Modern Browsers Keep You Safe (Without Telling You)
item.dc:creator: Faisal Rasool
item.description: How many of these did you know?
item.content:encoded: On occasion, you might have seen a red warning from your internet browser when it blocks access to a potentially harmful website. Blocks like those are only one of the many, many security measures modern browsers have in place to keep you safe online.
